title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story about the mysterious Jay Gatsby and his unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel that explores the dangers of totalitarianism and extreme political ideology.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A profound tale of racial injustice in the Deep South during the 1930s, as seen through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic romantic comedy that deals with issues of manners, marriage, and morality in early 19th century England.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of Holden Caulfield, a teenager navigating the challenges of growing up in 1950s New York.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy tale of Bilbo Baggins' unexpected journey to win a share of a treasure guarded by a dragon.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to hunt the great white whale, Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A sweeping narrative about Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars, blending history, philosophy, and fiction.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An ancient Greek epic poem that follows Odysseus' perilous journey home after the Trojan War.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical drama about a young man who commits a murder and grapples with guilt and redemption.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian vision of a technologically advanced future society where happiness is enforced through artificial means.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A tragic tale of love, infidelity, and societal pressure in 19th century Russia.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel exploring faith, doubt, and morality through the lives of three brothers.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An allegorical journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise, guided by the Roman poet Virgil.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A symbolic story about a shepherd boy's journey to fulfill his personal legend.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A Gothic novel about a scientist's hubristic attempt to create life and its unintended consequences.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A horror novel about Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England to spread his undead curse.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A sweeping story of justice, redemption, and love set in revolutionary France.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
description: A multi-generational tale of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A Gothic tale of vanity, hedonism, and moral corruption centered on a portrait that bears the sins of its subject.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: An orphaned girl's journey through hardship, love, and finding her place in society.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A haunting tale of passion and revenge set on the Yorkshire moors.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: The story of Pip, an orphan, and his journey through adversity, ambition, and self-discovery.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description: A powerful tale of sin, guilt, and redemption set in Puritan New England.

title: Mansfield Park
author: Jane Austen
description: A story of morality, class, and love as seen through the perspective of Fanny Price.
